meanings.definition: Wabblier (adjective): more unsteady or shaky in movement
meanings.sent1: The table became wabblier as the legs started to wobble.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was wabblier than the new one.
meanings.sent3: The wabblier jelly on the plate made it hard to eat with a fork.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence grew wabblier with each step she took on the narrow path.
meanings.sent5: The wabblier ground beneath their feet made them stumble and laugh.

meanings.definition: Wabblier (adverb): in a more unsteady or shaky manner
meanings.sent1: He walked wabblier after twisting his ankle.
meanings.sent2: The tree swayed wabblier in the strong wind.
meanings.sent3: The dancer moved wabblier as the music picked up speed.
meanings.sent4: The boat rocked wabblier as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The old clock ticked wabblier with each passing year.
